website_summaries.verdict: If you want a Weber for tailgating, camping, etc., this is one of the best portable grills out there.
pros: Durable and reliable, this may be the ultimate portable gas grill
cons: It's more than a bit expensive for a portable grill

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill. Very sturdy works great! Only difficulty is attaching small gas cans. Very difficult to get lined up and screwed on!! I use the adapter hose and large tank at home easy hook up. Don't know why small tanks hard to put on but we have several of these in the family and everyone has the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: CARRYON

customer_reviews.title: Worked great....once
customer_reviews.text: When I received the grill it was extremely easy to put together. I attached the propane without a problem and used the grill without incident. Grill heated up quickly and after turning off it was very easy to clean. The problem is when I went to use it the next time NOTHING happened. I went through the problem solving suggestions in manual and online and still NOTHING. I tried using a different propane tank(in case that was the problem) NOTHING. I had read other reviews warning of similar problems but I trusted the Weber name and now wish I hadn't.
customer_reviews.author: NYER1

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly portable - just a small patio grill
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write many reviews. I purchased this for the “portable” factor. To utilize on long fishing trips. There is absolutely nothing portable about this grill. It is Essentially a small patio grill, the lid does not latch, it pops up and slams down on every bulb, the grates rattle bang, etc. They make no mounts for it other than the cheaply made roll around cart. If you want a portable grill I’d suggest to keep looking. However the thing does look fancy AF
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The dial is useless for adjusting heat
customer_reviews.text: I regret ordering this. Left on vacation as it arrived and was not able to use it until a few days ago. Too late to return. It has one temperature - HOT. The dial is useless for adjusting heat. And, of course, no area to which you can move the meat to have less heat. Definitely do not recommend and frustrated that I can not return.
customer_reviews.author: Montanan

customer_reviews.title: always liked weber. got this cute little propane grill
customer_reviews.text: always liked weber. got this cute little propane grill. always had a charcoal one step which I loved but wanted to be lazy. I have only had this grill for a few months and used it half a dozen times. there is fire coming out of one of the pipes. temp won't regulate. says on my orders my window for return has lapsed. will try to call company.
customer_reviews.author: Trina S.

customer_reviews.title: You"ll Be Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this little grill to supplement a larger Weber gas grill we use for larger crowds. Does the trick for the two of us. Great for tailgating, heats up fast, well made & the array of colors that are offered now is a nice touch. The battery operated igniter sometimes come loose but not a problem if you check it before and after grilling. Others have mentioned that the 1 lb. propane cylinders are sometimes difficult to screw on but we didn't experience that. Overall a very good purchase. This is the third one we have purchased but the first for ourselves. Others were gifts several years ago and they are still performing admirably.
customer_reviews.author: DW in PA

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the Best Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this grill. It's 100% Weber - which says it all. It's well-built and designed. A substantial grill.....that fits my needs perfectly. I am unable to lift the standard LP gas tank that comes with larger grills. The screw-in canister is GREAT! And, this grill is perfect for smaller decks and porches. I, also, purchased the cart & cover and am EXTREMELY happy with all three. The choice of colors makes for a fun grill and has been a topic of conversation for my guests who 'help' me while I grill. Who wouldn't want a purple, fuchsia or other fun color grill?! This isn't an inexpensive grill, but it is the BEST!
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: wow - LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I had it one day. Easy to set up. Looks really cool. I wanted a small grill for an apartment and maybe to put in the car. This is are great size. I wouldn't want it any bigger. I love the fact i screw in a 16oz fuel container or hook it up to my 20 gallon propane tank (extra hose required) . The laminated chart for grilling times and temps is really helpful along with the built in thermometer. Make sure you get some wood chips to get a smokey flavor. LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Awe-some-o

customer_reviews.title: This grill sucks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this grill since last October ive only used it a couple dozen times it sits in my garage with a cover over it and I clean it regularly it’s not even a year in and already it barely has enough power to brown some hotdogs not impressed at all!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Schumaker

customer_reviews.title: Ignition switch falls out easily.
customer_reviews.text: Ignition switch falls out easily - have not been able to get through to customer service by either phone or email and the part does not appear on their web site. Not impressed so far. I get that this is challenging times, but I started with a email on Sat, it is now Wednesday. I got an automated response with a # and the message that someone would be back in touch with me. I am now on hold for the second phone call, going on an hour so far. I hung up after 45 minutes the other night.
customer_reviews.author: NanaMBC

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous little grill
customer_reviews.text: This is my second "Clam shell" grill. It is an upgrade from my last one in that it has wings and a thermometer. The thermostat seems to be better than my first one because it actually adjusts from around 600 degrees on high to 350 degrees on low. The new lighter knob is bigger than the old one and the lid handle is slightly further away from the lid keeping it cooler. I like the sturdy cast metal shell and the split grilling surface. My old one died of old age and abuse. I'm hoping to take better care of this one and have it last for the rest of my life (I'm 71).
customer_reviews.author: Chascopp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the RV
customer_reviews.text: Amazing small grill with huge temperature. We also own a large Weber with the wok and wok insert grates, but needed a small grill for our RV. Easy to clean and move around. We have a folding table for our RV that we use to prop the grill up when we do not have a picnic table, so the grill cart is unnecessary. Excellent grill, highly recommend as a permanent or secondary grill.
customer_reviews.author: Newport

customer_reviews.title: Light weight exceptionally powerful, portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Baby Q, my first one I used solidly 5x a week for 7 years when I was living on my boat, but it was damaged in a move and my wife convinced me to get a full size grill with he insurance money when we became land lubbers! Fast forward 3 years, two small charcoal portable grills and a Kamado joe. Webber has actually taken a great grill and made it better! Lighter, hotter, quicker to temp, and standard thermostat and side tables. There isn’t a better portable grill on the market. You will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted to Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise its nicely built. Theres a forum with lots of people ...
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough. After preheating to 500 I placed a steak on the grill only to have it seared for 30 seconds. After that my steak was not getting the caramelization. It took 30 minutes to cook with the lid down. I can place my hands within 1 inch of the grill and hold it there without getting burned; this is on high with a new propane canister. Customer service said its designed to only be used with the "cover on." Really? Otherwise its nicely built. Theres a forum with lots of people complaining about grill sharing my issue. Please check before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: a.c.

customer_reviews.title: We love this portable grill.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grill for my husband and myself, because when we go RV'ing, it's nice to be able to barbecue food out in nature. I already have a Weber Q-3200 at home. I purchased this beautiful bright blue grill and the color is cheery and blends with the design of our RV. This is light-weight and easy to use. There is nearly no assembly, just to attach the handle and the propane line. This is a small grill, but perfect for us to use, being just the two of us. We probably could accommodate 1 to 2 more, but I suppose that depends on what is being cooked. I love Weber grills, they are well made and last forever.
customer_reviews.author: PansyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Big grill performance in a little package!
customer_reviews.text: Grilled so far: a couple amazing new york strip steaks, some angus burgers and the best...a 12 pound turkey! The turkey took 5 hours. Was a Thanksgiving hit! Best part...pull the pan on the bottom of the grill, put the drippings on the stove and have the most amazing gravy ever!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best portable grill I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I'm very happy with mine. Gives a nice sear, cooks steaks fast. Nice size for picnic tables, used it a few times now and it was a quick learning curve. Holds heat good, cooks nice and even. The cast iron heats up fairly fast and makes nice pork chops! I usually cook over wood, but this is so nice for the days I don't have time for the stick burner.
customer_reviews.author: James Sage

customer_reviews.title: can't cook baby back on this!!
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in Amazons description does it say you cannot cook baby back ribs on this grill, and that is what I primarily wanted to cook. The low temperature on this grill is 450* and it's not possible to slow cook. I didn't find this out until I tried to cook some ribs. In the enclosed grilling guide in tiny print, with a tinier asterisk it says you need a Weber Q2000 to grill ribs. The box is long gone and as I bought the stand I'm out $300.
customer_reviews.author: Lou E.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice bbq..but some lame flaws
customer_reviews.text: A very nice grill..quality construction and design. It has a few interesting quirks..it heats up very quickly..and while i like the grill bbqing surface..the wider vanes..as oppossed to thinner wire ones ...will absolutely burn bbq sauce onto the grilling surface to the point you better have something approaching a chisel to bust it off. All in all though im very happy..and now ive had it a few months..the burner is already clogged with crap..if i cant get this working again im going to be ticked off
customer_reviews.author: Jay  C.  Everson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy one of these
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the most aggravating piece of junk I have ever bought and tried to use. It won’t light, it won’t stay lit and it doesn’t really get hot enough to cook anything. I tried calling Weber, but all you get is a crappy automatic phone tree. I would take a sledgehammer to it right now, but they would probably throw me out of the RV park I’m in for being a crazy man. I’m going to make a hobby of bad mouthing Weber as often as I can to pay them back for the frustration they’ve caused me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this grill!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my word; I love this grill! The orange color is perfect (cheery and fun). I use it on my patio, and I also take it with me to parks and beaches. The built-in thermometer makes it easy to know when the grill is heated up. The grates are easy to clean. I love the folding side shelves, which make taking the rill on the road easy. I bought a cover to go with mine (glad I did). I feel like the quality is excellent (well worth the $$), and I am confident that the parts will be replaceable through Weber if anything breaks down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Patti R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grill - very pleased 😀
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Q1200 which was recommended by a friend who is an experienced grill master. This grill is the perfect size for singles, couples, or grilling for a small group. You can also get the griddle to expand it’s use. I used it for the first time today grilling a New York strip - it came out a perfect medium rare! The grill got up to 550 degrees in less than 10 minutes giving a perfect sear with great grill marks. Looking forward to using this great grill for many different meals!
customer_reviews.author: LCB

customer_reviews.title: Cooks beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an early Father's Day gift, and I love it! The compact size means it packs easily and does not take much space on the deck, and it cooks very nicely. The flame is lower but more even than the big grill I was using, and the food is closer to it; so it actually cooks faster and more evenly. Setup is fast as easy too. I hook mine up to a larger 16lb refillable tank, using an adapter hose I bought separately, but I can also unhook it and use small disposable tanks for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Rabh Marrach

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best portable grill on the market easy to put together ...
customer_reviews.text: Hands down best portable grill on the market easy to put together could be grilling in less than 15 minutes box to hot grill. I let mine burn off for 30 minutes or so the first time. When your done grilling leave the light d open for a faster cool down. I lay a tin foil strip on top of the cooking surface before folding the side trays over onto the grill grates, place the cover on it and it and your done.
customer_reviews.author: Gulfcoast

customer_reviews.title: Burner tube problem.
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill, but I’m having trouble now with the burner tubes only lighting up partially. I’ve scraped residual grease off of them but still only get about 1/3 of the tubes lit up. It sucks that I can only use one corner of my grill. Help, please. Any advice, Weber?
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and portable
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it comes in colors. The actual assembly is very minimal. You will need a screwdriver. We bought this grill for our daughter and family to use on their camping trips. Features that are worth the extra expense are: cast iron grates, these last longer over time, the two small shelves, these are handy for putting your sauces etc. rather than an old picnic table. It is a well built little grill. Not using this as it being a gift, could not answer the heat distribution nor the temperature control on it. Since I cook on cast iron on my grill at home, I do know that this provides a more even cooking space.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartment
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing. I live in an apartment with a covered back porch. There’s absolutely no way a standard size grill would fit there without being crowded. This grill is perfect for my family to make a great grilled dinner that we have been deprived of for some time now. Super easy to use, clean, and store. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a good portable gas grill. It will hold up well as it is cast iron. I wish it would get a little hotter. I would like to use it to sear steaks. If you wait 20 minutes, it will just get hot enough to do one side however it looses heat rapidly after opening and is difficult therefore to sear the other side of a steak. The temp control pretty much stays between 350 to 450 degrees no matter where you adjust. On a windy day I suggest you block some of the wind that will enter from the sides of the grill to keep the heat in.
customer_reviews.author: GTB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill!!!! I went back and forth between this grill and the coleman tailgate grill when I was looking for one to take on my camping trips. I couldn’t be happier that I spent a little more and went with the Weber. It has outperformed my expectations. I have a Weber Genesis at my home and have really been happy with it so I figured this one should be good also, and it is. It heats up very quick and it does not have any cold spots. The side folding tables are a great feature, and the thermometer is very handy as well. I will definitely buy this grill again if I am in the market ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Tony gleason

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made? Won't last?
customer_reviews.text: May update this review after use. Just assembled and the battery powered electric igniter doesn't fit snugly into its home. It's wobbling and feels like it's will break very early on. I've tried to assemble and reassemble but nothing works. Please see video. Everything else seems ok so far. Seller, please contact me if I'm doing something wrong here. I want my review to be accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that i was skeptical about this grille only having 8500 btu output. Boy i was wrong , this grille is the best i have ever owned-plenty of heat with no cold spots anywhere just nice consistent temperature. Very well built and finished. I took the time and seasoned the grates with cooking oil and placed them in my oven at 350 twice letting them cool in between and it seems to have paid of nicely as food does not stick like other grilles i have owned. I bought this for camping but it cooks so well i think my big grille will be headed for the scrap yard soon. Thanks Weber!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gas valve does not work
customer_reviews.text: Gas canister will not fit in the grooves. Tried multiple canisters. Makes the whole thing useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little Weber!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this grill! I do wish it were a bit lighter because I'm using it on a boat, but it is amazing. It heats up fast and I can control the temp really well too. I love the fact that it is green and so cute. Glad I didn't go with a true 'boat' grill and shell out the extra cash. I love Weber grills at home so I had to try it.
customer_reviews.author: 2010ponygirl

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it. Perfect size for the two of us
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it. Perfect size for the two of us. We also purchased the extension hook up for the propane tank and modifiied the outside counter it sits upon so the propane tank is invisible inside. We are pleased with how fast it heats up for the perfect charing on steaks, chops or burgers and hot dogs. Also have cooked corn on the cob and roasted vegetables. This grill handles it all. So good things do come in smaller packages!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: 16 oz canisters don't fit!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to use the grill yet because the 16 oz canisters I bought at Home Depot don't fit. The handle is in the way. You can only use the 16.4 oz. I called the "grill expert" at Weber but he had no idea about the problem. I'm considering just biting the bullet and getting a hose and a large tank.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Prentiss

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!! Great grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is like having a big grown-up grill with you on your camping trip! I loved everything I cooked on it. Well worth the money! PS. I just learned that the little side tables fold in under the lid for storage and travel. This might be better than my full-size grill on my deck! Sturdy and well made!!
customer_reviews.author: ECG

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product compromised by packing/shipping
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived with a large gouge/tear in the side. While contents appeared undamaged, it was obviously not packed/re-packed the same as when it left the factory. Contents was not properly secured by cardboard packing. That aside, product was typical high-quality that I've come to expect from Weber. Ultimately returned product because I was looking for a grill with bars, vs a cast plate with openings. Also, box only contained only one grill plate although picture showed two plates. Hopefully the shipment wasn't missing one and I don't get challenged by Amazon for not returning everything.
customer_reviews.author: Steve - CA

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: For some reasons there is difference in price for different colors of Baby Q. Of course I opted for the cheapest. What is under the lids is more important. In this case it is very portable, but well made cast iron grill. With a bit of experience one learn how to handle cooler zones. I like the thermometer, and we also used hose for bigger container. My old Baby Q lasted 13 years, with replaced grill burner tube. Parts are easy to find, and easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Duda S.

customer_reviews.title: Cooking is ok
customer_reviews.text: We've used Weber patio grills for thirty years and have never been disappointed. This one does a fine job, but needs refinement: 1) on-off needs to lock in place for 'off;' it's too easy to unintentionally turn it on; 2) the flames are too far away from the grill; won't heat a cast iron Dutch oven; 3) the side panels need to completely fold out of the way, rather than sticking up like a bird starting to fly.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill as a replacement for the Q1000 series that we had for 10+ years. It is better than my old grill, which I loved. The porcelain-coated grill surface cleans easily. Temperatures are just right for the meals that we prepare for the 2 of us. If there is any downside, it is that the large diameter gas bottles are a tight fit next to the grill frame. But they do fit.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T

customer_reviews.title: Really like it
customer_reviews.text: I own a Weber charcoal grill and love it but wanted something that was faster to start cooking on without having to wait for the charcoal to get ready (usually 30 minutes). This does the trick. I also bought the stand for it because I won't be hauling it around for tailgating, although the stand folds down if that's what you want to use it for. I keep my temperature control almost to the lowest setting, this cooks around 350 degrees. I like how the tables are foldable and fit inside the grill when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: jmw1160

customer_reviews.title: Control valve needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several other full sized Weber grills that I absolutely love, but I think Weber needs to fix an issue with the control valve on this grill. Even with the burner turned down as low as it will go, the temperature inside the grill still soars to over 500°. The only way to control it to a lower temperature is to prop the lid partially open.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for BBQ for 1 or two
customer_reviews.text: VERY easy setup and perfect for a small group (1 or 2). I recommend the Weber 6557 Q Portable Cart also. Temperature gauge on cover is conveniently located and helps make grilling a breeze. With a full sized multi-burner grill, 4 season grilling is possible. Not enough heat with this grill for deep winter climates but works well once the temp gets above 45. Small footprint leaves much more room on your deck. LOVE this grill!!!
customer_reviews.author: hereistand

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this grill
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Weber grill.... the previous two were full-sized. Because we moved and only have a balcony we had no choice but to choose a smaller grill. This little powerhouse has been a total pleasure. It heats up to 600 degrees fast! And best of all, it is incredibly fuel efficient. We added a connection for a 20 lb propane tank and have been grilling daily for over a month on the same tank. Incredible! And, clean up is a breeze. Love, love, love this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Brillhart

customer_reviews.title: great little grill
customer_reviews.text: I presented this grill as a house-warming gift for a family member. I assembled it for them and found it to be extremely easy to put together. I also got them a 20-pound (full size) LP tank and hose kit with built-in tank level gauge, and we have all been very happy with it. I chose this model of Weber grill because I had been using a Q1000 series grill myself for about 8 years prior - they are very well made and provide great service. I highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: EllieCapelli

customer_reviews.title: Weber is Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grill for small jobs. You have to keep it clean and covered. I received a grill from this link that wasn't working, and because I didn't set it up until grilling season, there wasn't any recourse for replacement or compensation .. so be careful with this site and its buyer protection. Next time, I would buy from Home Depot or another seller. Anyway, Weber is a fantastic company and they sent me a new starter. I installed it, and the grill works well. Recommend stand and cover. Also, I recommend using Weber brand products. The other stuff may be a little less expensive, but you'll be happy with the quality and fit of Weber accessories.
customer_reviews.author: My Little Blue Heron

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for one person
customer_reviews.text: Could not handle big propane tanks after husband passed away so got this one to use with smaller canisters of gas. It works very well for that. Starting the tank screw on was tricky but I got it okay. I also got the cover and griddle. The cover needs to be bigger so it will adequately cover the gas control knob. The griddle worked just great even though I didn't season it.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We seldom cook for more than four, so this met all our needs. Very easy to assemble, solid, heavy duty grates, easy to clean and lightweight. Bought the cart for it, too, and that worked out very well! So much better than the crummy sheet steel ones you get every two years at the supermarket. A total winner.
customer_reviews.author: Martha's Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Weber is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill for a Christmas gift for my son. We have owned the same model for several years and absolutely love it. It is big enough to cook ample quantities of food, but small and light enough to take along on camping or picnic excursions. It cooks evenly and is not so hot that your food is charred on the outside and raw on the inside. It is also easy to clean. I would recommend a Weber to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Northrop

customer_reviews.title: Good grill, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the ease of operation and even grilling- steaks and hot dogs so far. Started right up and easy enough to use right out of the box. Got this for tailgating (hopefully) this year and already purchased the weather cover separately and will likely get the rolling stand as well. Replaced an old Coleman camper grill that lasted for years and hope this does the same. Only drawback is the price- the old Coleman grill was around $50 or so, but they stopped making, otherwise never would have spent this much for a camper/tailgater grill.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: love it. Just read instructions let heat up watch ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use at our RV when traveling, love it. Just read instructions let heat up watch temp cooks great. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jean pierce

customer_reviews.title: Best little grill on the market!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly! Heats quickly and cooks food evenly. I cook cook my meat and vegetables on this several times a week!! Love it!! Best little grill around!! Works great even when windy out. Clean up us easy also. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: My second Weber grill. Bought this one to replace my old one. I love the size and it grills everything. My old one is over 10 years old but still works. It travels easily, can use small propane canisters or at home hook up to a larger tank. I have a rolling cart that it sets on and doesn’t take up much space. We use our 3-4 times a week. Great for fish, shrimp, burger or steaks Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pauley

customer_reviews.title: Great grill,  you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I like this grill almost as much as my full size Weber at home. It’s the best camp grill I’ve ever had. Just remember to fold the side trays out before you light it. I almost forgot the first time I used it. Much better than the other ones I’ve owned. I don’t know if I’m allowed to use brand names but I’ll say it’s the one that the stand folds down and you can wheel it around.
customer_reviews.author: gaggles64

customer_reviews.title: Good but too drafty
customer_reviews.text: Grill works great if there is no wind. Hardly works if wind. Gap in sides where the tables fold in is too large. I'm trying to come up with a way to block it. I use this on road trips in rest areas. If it is windy it is not useable. I checked weather and it said wind was only 10mph Not a bad grill but needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BBQ
customer_reviews.text: The best grill ever. I bought this for my campaign trip. Used 5 gallons propane tank with it. Worked very well. Big enough for a small group of people. You can cook for 5-7 persons at the time. Easy to clean. Well made and easy to use. Money well spend.
customer_reviews.author: Max.

customer_reviews.title: Love this lil grill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our motorhome but will probably move it to the boat and get the larger one for the motorhome since I have room for the bigger one and usually cook for 6. Really like the design and the catch system underneath. I bought a griddle plate for it and use it for breakfast and searing steaks. Because it is made of aluminum will last forever probably. And everyone carries parts for it.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Got my Grill On!
customer_reviews.text: After taking a year off from grilling, I'm back with my new Weber Baby Q. Perfect size for grilling smaller portions. Split grates makes it very easy to clean and I love the battery operated starter. All good!
customer_reviews.author: Stuie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fabulous. Bought because my sister had it and couldn’t find in ANY stores in my area. It is worth every penny!!! Convenient size but actually cooks a lot more than you would think.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camping grill!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic grill! Easy to operate and clean. The side tables fold up into the grill for easy transport. I had one minor issue with setup in that there was no indication how the battery should be installed in the igniter but obvyif it doesn’t work one way it’ll work the other way. I wish the lid had some kind of latch for transport but that’s not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: AnxiousCucumber

customer_reviews.title: I like it but it does not have room to screw ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but it does not have room to screw in one of the fat 16oz propane bottle. I have to use the 12 oz soldering propane bottle which is kind of a pain to find readily. Grill is great and love the flame though.Tried to modify it somehome to accomadate the 16 oz propane bottles but didnt want to change it so to make none usable. Thats the only thing I dont like. Did not expect this at all.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic grill for traveling with 2 people. Heats up fast and even. Fairly compact. If I had to come up with a complaint, it would be that I wish it was slightly shorter (not as tall) so it would store in my trunk better, but I remove the lid each time for that which isn't a big deal. Thankfully the lid comes on and off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Guilfoyle

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill. We love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grill. We have added it to our motorhome gear while traveling. It is hooked up with a quick connect to the motorhome propane. We have already used it several times and love it. We got lots of compliments on the grill by our visitors. It heats up very quickly and cooked the food perfectly. Fits in the bay easily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda g

customer_reviews.title: Great looking BBQ!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this one because it was too small for the stand I bought but i know my sister has it and loves it so I didn’t want to rate it badly. It just didn’t work for the stand I bought so make sure you buy the correct stand for this one. It only fits one particular stand. The simpler looking one.
customer_reviews.author: Nannie D.

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: This works very well to cook for one or two people. Heats fast, has built-in thermometer. Only one minor thing I don’t like - the top is round, so you can’t put anything on top. I used to put plates on top my old grill to warm them. But I really do love this little grill. Great for spur of the moment cooking.
customer_reviews.author: The Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: this grill holds more than it seems. really nice capacity and seems well made. love the cast iron grill grates and the electronic ignition. it's easy to clean. the grill gets plenty hot and spreads the heat evenly. the thermometer in the lid is a nice plus. I purchased a flat grate for one of the sides, so it's quite flexible with how you can cook with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this type of grill 3yrs ago for our personal use, we purchased this as a gift for our daughters family. They love it for all the reasons we do. It small but big enough for a family of 4. It sets up quickly. Heats up quickly, cooks evenly and well. Only drawback is you can’t use it for indirect cooking. I love the grill pan accessory. No more frying bacon smell in the house.
customer_reviews.author: KDM houston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this to use when looking to grill out instead of cooking inside the camper!! It has become my best friend, and I use it at home now to, and pretty much forgot about my 6 burner charbroil!! This thing is awesome... easy set-up, easy cleanup, even cook surface...so awesome I bought my brother one for his b-day and he agrees!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for the RV.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our BBQ for the RV. This little gem worked very well and was a great purchase. We did not get the stand but that would be up to you to decide if you need it. The campground we went to had tables and a specific metal sheet for BBQ'S to sit on. It is compact for storing under RV and cooked out food perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pamm659

customer_reviews.title: Love this Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small gas grill. Plenty of grill space to grill a number of items. Even heating. Love that I don't have to deal with the large propane canisters. And, the small ones used for this grill last a lot longer than I thought they would. I use it constantly. I didn't buy it for tailgating but because of its compact size. Another great Weber product!
customer_reviews.author: Duney

customer_reviews.title: It's just two people in my house so we don't need some big grill and this thing has nice, even heat
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of this little grill. It's just two people in my house so we don't need some big grill and this thing has nice, even heat. It heats up really fast which is great since much of what i use it for is searing meat that i've already cooked sous vide. The hose to hook it up to a big propane tank is a worthwhile investment and will save considerable money but we keep a few small tanks around in case we want to easily take the grill somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The igniter module came broken; therefore, the igniter could not be mounted. I called Weber's number on the instructions and they quickly offered to send out the replacement parts. 5 stars for customer service, 4 stars for quality of product, and 3 stars based on price and/or value. Average rating is 4 stars and is a fair assessment.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best small grill on narket
customer_reviews.text: Great portable grill. Have the next larger size the past 8 years and it’s as good as new. High price but quality product that will last.
customer_reviews.author: App1

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: good product. Turn heat lower than you would with a larger grill because food is closer. With gas wide open, lid closed it will go well past 500 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Grilling Has Never Been Easier
customer_reviews.text: Want a grill that doesn't take up a lot of room, is easy to use, and grills absolutely delicious meats and vegetables? Get this Weber Q1200. We love using it. If you don't want to change the small propane canisters often, connect a larger one that requires less frequent replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: great little grill
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Weber. It is so easy to use, and since I mostly cook for just two people it is plenty big. The heat distribution is great, pretty even all the way to the edges. It looks great too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Feeman

customer_reviews.title: Split Grill, Yes!
customer_reviews.text: The split grill is much easier to clean. I now put it in the dishwasher after each use. The ceramic coating on the grill let’s everything come off easily. This replaces another one after 3 years when the regulator failed.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskalouie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We're so glad we purchased this little grill! We've had it about 6 weeks and have used it 3-4 days each week. It's easy to operate and holds more food on it than we expected. It's fairly easy to keep clean; we usually soak the grates for a while just to make it even easier.
customer_reviews.author: FrugalNut

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: If there was a 10 star rating I would have given the WeberQ a 10! I love grilling and was worried that while traveling in our RV that I wouldn’t be able to grill! This is perfect! Small enough to pack and big enough to eventually grill steaks, use my skillet on it and easy to clean up!!
customer_reviews.author: GARY G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable and great travel ability!
customer_reviews.text: BADASS GRILL! I bought this last minute for a camping trip and I couldn’t be happier. I installed a griddle on one side and cooked every meal on this bad boy, side dishes included. I leave it outside and it stands up very well. I was able to cook enough food for two, including two big ribeyes and sautéed veggies on the griddle. Girlfriend was very happy with the result. 😉
customer_reviews.author: FrenchE88

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grilling for four to six steaks...
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure if this grill would be large enough for my wife and I but it is the perfect size. Even when we have guests, I can grill 2 to 6 steaks simply and perfectly. The directions that came with the grill are right on for preparing steaks medium rare and for dogs and hamburgers. Small and easy to store when it’s not in use, it allows us to keep our small deck clear in between cooking sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time last weekend. It was fantastic. So glad we got it. Cleaned up really easy as well. We put heavy duty aluminum foil in and over the drip pan, so when ready to put away, we just folded up the aluminum and very little clean up there.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy! Not too small, not too big. It fits my condo balcony perfectly. I got 6 good size hamburgers on it at one time with room to spare. Grate is a good heavy cast iron. The side tables are a little small but a nice feature is that they fold in out of the way. Produces plenty of heat. Don't know how long the gas canister will last. Haven't used it often enough to find out yet.
customer_reviews.author: cixtiesgirl

customer_reviews.title: Quality that you'd expect from Weber
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked that this performed as well as my full-size Weber. The quality and weight of this is far and above anything else out there. It lights quickly with a button and was able to get up to temp, and grilled at the campsite to the same results as I get at home. It folds up the sides and fits perfectly in my storage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: My little "space ship" grill
customer_reviews.text: Cute as a button. I also ordered the cart and the grill cover. The grill was mostly assembled, and I was able to put the cart together without too much trouble. It works beautifully. Heats up quickly. Cleans up easily. I had a bit of a search to find the correct propane canisters. They are located in the plumbing department at Home Depot. Also, installing the canisters takes more strength than I have, so my daughter does that for me when needed. Perhaps in time I shall master that skill as well.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: It may be small but has quickly replaced our larger grill. Plus we can take it camping with us. I like the fact that you can use the smaller, camping propane tanks or purchase the adapter and use a larger tank.
customer_reviews.author: seminolejoy

customer_reviews.title: Weber Grill
customer_reviews.text: This meets all of our expectations for a return to apartment living. Fits just right and does what it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: jimd2k

customer_reviews.title: Best grill EVER!
customer_reviews.text: My first grill! I bought it for camping which it’s easy to pack for trips and use while set up on a table or something. I have not bought the stand yet. Makes all steaks great! Would recommend to everyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Propane attachment is made of pot metal and snaps right off. I bought two (mistake), one for myself and one for my mother. Both broke. Buy a Napoleon. I bought mine in 1996. Works great. Stainless burner. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: rich12_66

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for a small grill to replace a larger, older grill. This Weber fit the bill. It works great and is a great size for the two of us.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill! Super happy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill! works great and cooks food very well and evenly. I got the model with the side trays. If I was doing it all over, I'd probably get the one without the trays. No big deal though, still awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome grill! I bought this to replace a Coleman portable to use on camping trips. The Q1200 worked like a champ and the nice thing is there were no flair ups and the porcelain coated burners made it easy to clean up. I highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Weber Portable Grill Q1200
customer_reviews.text: Very nice . Good quality. No "Hot Spots" on the burner. Cooks evenly. Like the foldup trays on each end, color is nice. Very compact for having on the camper on mounting arm. I recommend getting a propane hose with the propane bottle fitting to use direct to the camper propane tanks instead of the bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grill for RV campsite
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to find a grill that fir our needs. We have a motor home, and everything needs to fit into a certain place. However, it must also do what we need it to do. This little grill does. It heats up in a flash. The heat was evenly distributed. I cooked ribeye steaks and they were tender and delicious. Clean up is a breeze. I highly recommend this grill. I also purchased the griddle, which I haven’t used yet. It’s well made and I know it will do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grill 3 years ago. It has sat outside uncovered for almost that entire time. I did have to replace the burners this year but other than that it still works great. I gave it a 4 because while it does cook great steaks, burgers, brats, etc, I don't think you could slow cook anything in it. Even on low it is pretty hot and the grate is very close to the frame. I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another if this one ever craps out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: Handle problem
customer_reviews.text: Only reason why I didn't do 5 stars is because I am unable to pick up the BBQ normally with the handles. Where the hook up for the tank is right below the handle and there isn't enough enough room for my hand. This makes it very hard for me to move the BBQ. Beside what I above, I love the bbq. We use it for camping very easy to clean and cooks evenly. PLEASE FIX THE HANDLE PROBLEM.
customer_reviews.author: jean olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best house warming gift I ever bought! We use it for the housewarming party and all our friends enjoy it. It is so continent that we can move it around. Like it and heartily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Great for Two or Three
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning to host the neighborhood, this is not the grill for you. However, if, like me, you want delicious food cooked on an evenly heated, easy to clean surface for you and one or two guests, then this is the one. I also purchased a stand for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brogan

customer_reviews.title: ... gauge over 10 years ago and it still works great. The starter still works too
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of the simple ones with no temp gauge over 10 years ago and it still works great. The starter still works too. I work construction and use it on my job sites for lunches. The kids are grown and its just my wife and I now so I bought this one to be our main grill and love it. I retired my big propane grill and use this one all the time. One of my favorite features is the two-piece grate. It's easy to clean and cooks food great. When we have company it will cook 4 large steaks. Look not further. Buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Weber what did you expect?
customer_reviews.text: Need a grill...Buy a Weber! Use this grill on my pontoon boat and it’s awesome! Purchased the boat mount (not a Weber Accessory) on Amazon. I even use this grill at home when cooking small meals and I have a full size Weber. Great grill. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a quality grill for those portable uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

product_meta.title: Weber 51060001 Q1200 Liquid Propane Grill,Titanium
product_meta.description: Color:TitaniumNotice how sturdy the shroud feels as it opens smoothly on its hinges? See how the burners roar to life on the very first try? Delighted by how simple it is to achieve a mouthwatering meal every time? It's no accident. Weber spends countless hours perfecting the grilling systems on its gas grills, assuring easy assembly, an evenly heated cooking surface, and precision controls so you can tone things down or up to the perfect heat level for direct or indirect cooking.
feature_bullets: One stainless steel burner produces 8500 BTU-per-hour to heat 189 square-inch total cooking area. Dimensions - Lid Open and Tables Out (inches)-24.6 H x 40.9 W x 20.5 D. Lid Closed and Tables Out (inches)-15.5 H x 40.9 W x 16.5 D
Porcelain-enameled cast-iron cooking grates and cast aluminum lid and body
Fully assembled out of box. Battery type: AAA
Easy-start electronic ignition and infinite control burner valve settings
Uses disposable 14.1 or 16.4 oz LP cylinder (sold separately).Glass-reinforced nylon frame
3D interactive assembly instructions for this product are available through the free BILT app.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,345 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
